definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: A cowboy fell off his horse and broke his leg on the prairie.
sentences.chinese: 一個牛仔在大草原上從馬背上摔了下來，摔斷了腿。

sentences.english: A little man got off the horse's back .
sentences.chinese: 一位小個子的男士跨下馬背。

sentences.english: What she write is a peasant on the horseback say come on.
sentences.chinese: 什麼她寫是一個農民在馬背言來在。

sentences.english: Fasten the saddle on the horse's back.
He saddled his horse, mounted, and rode away at a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 套上鞍子，跨上馬背疾馳而去。

sentences.english: Sengoku warrior on horseback has been created from hundreds of thousands of rice plants.
sentences.chinese: 馬背上的戰國武士用水稻幾十萬棵。

sentences.english: On horseback, we travel around to bring joy to our herders.
sentences.chinese: 我們騎在馬背上，走四方，給牧民帶來快樂。

sentences.english: The horse suddenly reared up and threw me off.
sentences.chinese: 忽然用後腿直立起來，把我摔下馬背。

sentences.english: The old man slapped the saddle upon the mare's back.
sentences.chinese: 老人啪的一聲把鞍子放到馬背上。

sentences.english: My ancestors rode around on horses.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖先在馬背上討生活。

sentences.english: This horse won the golden horseshoes to take me on his back.
sentences.chinese: 這匹馬是因爲把我馱在馬背上才贏得金馬掌的。

sentences.english: The saddle galled the horse's back.
The sniper aimed his riffle at the man on the horse.
sentences.chinese: 狙擊手用步槍瞄準了馬背上的那個人。

sentences.english: When he was young, he could vault into the back of a horse.
sentences.chinese: 當他年輕的時候，他能夠一躍而跨到馬背上。

sentences.english: She was unhorsed while riding in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 她在花園騎馬時被馬從馬背上掀了下來。

sentences.english: They were highly disciplined and masters with using the bow and arrow on horseback.
sentences.chinese: 他們具有高度紀律性，是馬背上技藝高超的弓箭手。

definition: display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
to lean unsteadily from side to side (idiom)/to sway/(of buildings etc) to lean at a crazy angle
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
